QAPair.Question: What is (are) Widely spaced teeth ?
QAPair.Answer: Widely spaced teeth can be a temporary condition related to normal growth and development of adult teeth. Wide spacing can also occur as a result of several diseases or continued growth of the jawbone.

QAPair.Question: What causes Widely spaced teeth ?
QAPair.Answer: Some diseases and conditions that can cause widely spaced teeth are: Acromegaly , Ellis-van Creveld syndrome , Injury, Morquio syndrome , Normal growth (temporary widening), Possible gum disease, Sanfilippo syndrome , Tooth shifting due to gum disease or missing teeth, Large frenum, Congenitally missing teeth,
